stalls.name: Mala Hotpot
stalls.sampleReview: Spicy and satisfying! A bit oily but worth it for the flavour punch.

stalls.name: Japanese Cuisine
stalls.sampleReview: The chicken katsu don is a classic. Always crispy and delicious.

stalls.name: Ayam Penyet
stalls.sampleReview: Best chili on campus, hands down. The chicken is perfectly fried.

stalls.name: Subway
stalls.sampleReview: A reliable and healthy option when you're in a hurry.

stalls.name: Caifan (Mixed Veg Rice)
stalls.sampleReview: Great variety of dishes, and the price is very reasonable for students.

stalls.name: Yong Tau Foo
stalls.sampleReview: Love that I can pick my own ingredients. The laksa soup base is amazing.

stalls.name: Indian Cuisine
stalls.sampleReview: The prata is fluffy and the curry has a deep, rich flavour. A must-try.

stalls.name: Taiwanese Delights
stalls.sampleReview: The braised pork rice (lu rou fan) feels authentic and comforting.

stalls.name: Pasta Express
stalls.sampleReview: Decent pasta for the price. The carbonara is creamy and filling.

stalls.name: Korean Cuisine
stalls.sampleReview: The bibimbap is served in a hot stone bowl, making the rice crispy.

stalls.name: Thai Food
stalls.sampleReview: Green curry is spicy and aromatic. Great value for the portion size.

stalls.name: Western Food
stalls.sampleReview: Classic chicken chop with mushroom sauce. Can't go wrong with it.

stalls.name: Noodle Bar
stalls.sampleReview: The ban mian is handmade and has a great chewy texture.
